title: Intro to Wolfram's Theory: Computation as Fundamental, a Sequence of Choices based on a Set of Rules
description:
Wolfram says computation is fundamental, but what is meant by computation? Is it a simulation? A computer algorithm? No. Glen defines it as a sequence of choices over time according to a set of rules.
Examples of forms of computation:  
plants
an instrument playing in a symphony
a person making choices about the path forward

Rule 30 gives a random output
Rule 110 is a one dimensional checker game that is Turing complete
Discovery in math is a creative process.

Every budding physicist must read Pierre Duhem's book, To Save the Phenomena, the history of physics from Plato to Galileo, rather than just learning the distilled cleaned up version of science offered in most universities.

Differs from Plato's theory of forms in that only that which is physically possible actually exists.

Information is more important than physical instantiation. Information is physical because it obeys the laws of physics.
Chaitin:  ideas should be fertile, a tool you can do more things with.
Before Hawking was Bechenstein, before him was John Archibald Wheeler, whose article It from Bit is revolutionary.

Landauer's principle:  computation always involves a cost in entropy. Information has to be erased at some point, and when it's erased, entropy is increased. 

And much more. I have more notes than I have energy to type them up.

Here are links to the things Glen and I have been listening to, and some docs Glen wants you to read.

Wolfram and Chaitin:  https://youtu.be/d8MWRkS1pek
Wolfram on consciousness (start at 3:00): https://youtu.be/iZoRh_L0JF4
Is math invented or discovered?  https://youtu.be/1RLdSvQ-OF0
Chaitin on what science can say about God: https://youtu.be/slURwmgTZbc
Computers without Memory:  https://youtu.be/vhiiia1_hC4
Sabine Hossenfelder, Groupthink:  https://youtu.be/7DnECJDLBDo
Why Information Grows, Cesar Hidalgo:  https://youtu.be/r38kK26SieE
Wolfram's update:  https://youtu.be/Sr6CmIzF6u0
John Wheeler, It from Bit:  https://philpapers.org/archive/WHEIPQ.pdf
Chomsky's hierarchy of language:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chomsky_hierarchy#The_hierarchy

Playlist of all the episodes of The Physics of Life with Glen:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SvoPzQtTzk&list=PLoARw9zo4EUZhxqfaqYU5yjy0-Tr8RlB4

Karen's website:  https://karenwongart.com
